title: Ticket #6469: condor_q batch mode reports incorrect value for DONE
description:
When displaying -batch mode (the default) for a set of non-dag jobs in which more than a single cluster shares a batch-name, the value reported in the DONE column will sometimes be incorrect. It appears the the total for a single cluster is being used for the calculation of the done quantity. 

[johnkn@submit-4 sleep]$ condor_q -job bad.ads


-- Jobads: bad.ads @ 10/31/17 12:20:36
OWNER  BATCH_NAME         SUBMITTED   DONE   RUN    IDLE  TOTAL JOB_IDS
johnkn CMD: /bin/sleep  10/31 12:17      1      6      _     10 4556393.1 ... 4556394.4

Total for query: 6 jobs; 0 completed, 0 removed, 0 idle, 6 running, 0 held, 0 suspended

[johnkn@submit-4 sleep]$ condor_q -job bad.ads 4556394


-- Jobads: bad.ads @ 10/31/17 12:20:36
OWNER  BATCH_NAME         SUBMITTED   DONE   RUN    IDLE  TOTAL JOB_IDS
johnkn CMD: /bin/sleep  10/31 12:17      2      3      _      5 4556394.1-4

Total for query: 3 jobs; 0 completed, 0 removed, 0 idle, 3 running, 0 held, 0 suspended

[johnkn@submit-4 sleep]$ condor_q -job bad.ads 4556393


-- Jobads: bad.ads @ 10/31/17 12:20:36
OWNER  BATCH_NAME         SUBMITTED   DONE   RUN    IDLE  TOTAL JOB_IDS
johnkn CMD: /bin/sleep  10/31 12:17      2      3      _      5 4556393.1-4

Total for query: 3 jobs; 0 completed, 0 removed, 0 idle, 3 running, 0 held, 0 suspended
remarks:
2017-Dec-20 12:08:43 by zmiller:
CODE REVIEW: Looks good. Note: The DONE column can still be "incorrect", because it is calculated using the information available from the SchedD at the time condor_q was run. Once a cluster of jobs leaves the queue, we no longer have information about it. So while we still won't necessarily have exact information for the DONE column, this change makes the displayed value better reflect the available information, so I sign off on it.
